contents.Header2: Display album art while playing music

contents.Text: This enables album art to be displayed.

contents.Header2: Display album art in the center

contents.Text: Enabled: This will put album art in the centre of the screen.
Disabled: This will put album art on the sidebar.

contents.Header2: Auto-clear album art when music stops

contents.Text: Enabled: This clears the image from memory when the song stops.
Disabled: Shows the image forever until the next song starts.

Enabled: This writes the generated padding image to disk in the config directory, either next to the binary or in the global config directory (for more information see [[[button:Config location][../Config/Advanced Settings]]]).
Disabled: Does not write the image to disk.
[[[warning:Note:]]] The value is temporarily stored in memory and is not saved persistently in the database. Consequently, it resets to `false` each time the program starts.
Enabled: This ignores the [[[warning:4096x4096]]] pixel limit.
Disabled: Enforces the [[[warning:4096x4096]]] pixel limit ensuring any images bigger are resized down to resonable sizes.

contents.Header2: Enable the source image for effects

contents.Text: Enabled: Forces the usage of the highest quality image for effect padding.
Disabled: Forces the cheapest and lowest quality image for effect padding.
This pads images to centre them and adds an effect on the padding area.
Tick what options you want the randomiser to select when starting a new song.
This menu is hidden when the randomiser is not selected as the "Image Padding Mode".
